Package odu.edu.cs.cs350.pne

Class ACMTrainer

  • java.lang.Object
    • odu.edu.cs.cs350.pne.ACMTrainer
  • public class ACMTrainer
extends java.lang.Object
    The ACMTrainer Program generates a training arff file by adding the document signature of a supplied document to an existing arff file.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        Coordinates the execution of the ACMTrainer Program. The user will supply the program with a path to a pdf/txt file and an assigned category. The supplied category should be a letter (A-K) that corresponds to one of the high-level areas of the ACM Computing Classification System. The result of this program will be the addition of document's document signature to an existing arff file. If the arff file does not exist, an Initial Trainer will run and create an initial arff file from sample data files with known corresponding classifications.
        Parameters:
        args - A series of valid paths to pdf/txt files.

      • isValidInputs

        public static boolean isValidInputs​(java.lang.String[] args)
        Returns true, if the user-supplied inputs consist of two inputs: 1) a path to a valid file and 2) a valid classification's key (A-K). Otherwise, this function returns false.
        Parameters:
        args - The user-supplied inputs
        Returns:
        True if the inputs are valid, and False otherwise

      • isValidPath

        public static boolean isValidPath​(java.lang.String path)
        Verifies that the user-supplied file path exists, is a valid document, and has the extension ".pdf" or ".txt".
        Parameters:
        path - A user-supplied file path
        Returns:
        True if the path is valid, and False otherwise

      • isValidCategory

        public static boolean isValidCategory​(java.lang.String category)
        Verifies that the user-supplied category is a letter (A-K).
        Parameters:
        category - A user-supplied category key
        Returns:
        True if the category key is valid, and False otherwise
